title: Job: Wisdom Is Not Yours Alone
summary: Job sarcastically responds to his friends, pointing out that they don’t hold a monopoly on wisdom. He argues that even the animals and nature show that God is in control of all things—including suffering.

faq.question: What does Job say about his friends' wisdom?
faq.answer: He mocks them, saying their knowledge is nothing special.

faq.question: How does Job describe God’s power?
faq.answer: As sovereign over kings, rulers, nations, and creation itself.
